Situation1: They have argued repeatedly this week about finances.
Expectation2: Communicate politely and professionally with customers
Situation2: Meeting the customer for handing over a package
Story: I stood outside the apartment building, package in hand, my phone buzzing in my pocket. It was him—my boyfriend—texting again about the argument we’d had last night. We’d been fighting all week about money, and I knew he expected me to call and talk things through, to be the one who smoothed things over. My chest tightened with guilt; I wanted to fix things, to be the understanding girlfriend he needed. But right now, I was on the clock, wearing my delivery uniform, and the customer was already waiting at the door. I had to greet her with a smile, speak politely, and make sure the handoff went smoothly. My mind raced between the urge to reply to his messages and the need to stay professional. I could feel my frustration simmering, afraid it might slip into my voice. I took a deep breath, torn between the demands of my job and the expectations of my relationship, unsure which role to answer first.
